Description: Red polished pottery bowl with flat base and outward flaring walls made of Nile silt clay. Exterior is red slipped and burnished along the body, and horizontally around the rim; the interior is uncoated, but well smoothed and scatter burnished. Base is slightly convex and worn.
Curator's comments: Brunton's Smooth Brown ware, SB18M. Made of Nile silt with fine organics and coarse sand.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (pl. xv11.18M)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
